prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant until a year ago. Now she's training to be a spirit medium.
Character 1
Name: Dr. Turner Grey
Description: The director of the Grey Surgical Clinic where the malpractice incident occurred.
Character 2
Name: Pearl Fey
Description: Ran away as soon as she saw me. A girl who is Maya's little cousin.
Character 3
Name: Morgan Fey
Description: Maya's aunt. She has a strange, powerful aura about her.
Character 4
Name: Lotta Hart
Description: Claims to be an investigative photographer. She lives for the next big scoop.
Character 5
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 6
Name: Ini Miney
Description: College student. A huge fan of the occult and is doing research in parapsychology.
Character 7
Name: Mimi Miney
Description: Died in a car accident 1 year ago. Was Ini's older sister, nurse at Dr. Grey's clinic.
Character 8
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister. She was a top notch lawyer and my mentor and friend forever.
Character 9
Name: Franziska von Karma
Description: Became a prosecutor in Germany at age 13. A prodigy who has never known defeat.
Character 10
Name: Ami Fey
Description: Kurain Channeling Technique founder. Legend says her soul is sealed in the Sacred Urn.
Character 11
Name: Director Hotti (purported)
Description: A peculiar patient who claims to be Director Hotti. Seems to be extremely "healthy".
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Guidemap (Fey Manor)
Description: A diagram of Fey Manor. Meditation room to the south. Channeling chamber north of meditation room. Side room to the east, have to go through winding path from meditation room to get to side room.
Evidence 2
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: Slightly translucent. It's small, but it has a deep, profound aura about it. Slightly translucent. It radiates softly with a mysterious light.
Evidence 3
Name: Newspaper Clipping 1
Description: One year ago on May 2nd, 14 patients died from malpractice at Grey Surgical Clinic.
Evidence 4
Name: Folding Screen
Description: About 8 inches off the ground is a small hole that looks like a bullet hole.
Evidence 5
Name: Black Key
Description: An old steel key. A green jewel is set in the center of the key's grip.
Evidence 6
Name: Newspaper Clipping 2
Description: Mimi Miney, nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic, died after falling asleep at the wheel. Articles about the car accident. This is a newspaper clipping about the death of Mimi Miney, the nurse who worked at Turner Grey's clinic. It reads how Mimi died as a result of her car crashing when she fell asleep at the wheel and Director Hotti fills in some further parts of the article later on. The content is as follows-Highway of Nightmares-May 24 - Late last night, two women's car crashed into a highway center divide. One of the women was not able to escape the flaming wreckage and died at the site. Ongoing investigation has revealed that the driver had fallen asleep at the wheel. -Ms. Ini Miney Holds Interview About Crash- I was like, really tired and I dropped off to sleep. Then there was this crash, and like, I woke up in a huge sea of flames. I was like, still half-asleep, but I opened the right door and like, got out. I don't, like, remember anything else. -Doctor Lurking in the Shadows? If Ms. Ini Miney is to be believed, the one driving the car was her sister, Mimi Miney. Mimi Miney was the nurse at Grey Surgical Clinic where 14 patients were accidentally overdosed to their death. Is this then, just a mere coincidence...? 
Evidence 7
Name: Floor Plans (Crime Scene)
Description: A diagram of the Channeling Chamber. A four sectioned mat in front of a platform at the head.
Evidence 8
Name: Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report
Description: After being stabbed in the chest, he was shot in the forehead at point-blank. Stabbed in chest then shot at point-blank. Gunpowder residue around bullet hole.
Evidence 9
Name: Pistol
Description: Murder weapon. Was Grey's. Two shots fired. Bears Maya's and Grey's fingerprints.
Evidence 10
Name: Knife
Description: Murder weapon. A small fruit knife. Belongs to the Fey's. Bears Maya's fingerprints.
Evidence 11
Name: Maya's Costume
Description: Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. There are blood splatters on it. Clothes Maya was wearing at the time of the murder. [caption] It is stained with blood splatter and a bullet hole is present in the sleeve. The robe is otherwise clean. It is purple in color.
Evidence 12
Name: Lotta's Photo 1
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is a photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot.
Evidence 13
Name: Lotta's Photo 2
Description: A picture taken at the murder scene. This is the second photo taken by Lotta Hart of Maya Fey after they break into the Channeling Chamber when they hear a gunshot. Turner Grey is lying dead on the floor after being shot behind her.
Evidence 14
Name: Sacred Urn
Description: Ami Fey's spirit is sealed within. It's chipped and cracked all over. Broken by Pearl right before the murder. Under repair in the hallway until police came.
Evidence 15
Name: Cloth Scrap
Description: Unburned remains found inside the garden incinerator. Small amount of blood is on it.
Evidence 16
Name: Pearl's Ball
Description: Pearl's favorite toy. She was playing with this at the time of the murder, it seems.
Evidence 17
Name: Clothing Box
Description: There is a hole that looks like a bullet hole about 8 inches off the ground.
Evidence 18
Name: License Photo
Description: Ini's photo for her driver's license. Director Hotti's treasured possession.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: Sorry, pal, but there's an even more incriminating piece of evidence.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: This is the costume the defendant was wearing at the time of the crime.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: As you can see, it's covered in blood.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The defendant attacked and killed a person who, without a doubt, was not fighting back.
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The characters, evidences, and testimonies are given. Let me start by going through each testimony and see which evidence might conflict with it.

First, the testimonies are from Gumshoe. Testimony 3 says the defendant (probably Maya) attacked and killed someone who wasn't fighting back. The key point here is that the victim wasn't fighting back. Now, looking at the evidence related to the murder weapons and the scenario.

Evidence 8 is Dr. Grey's Autopsy Report. It says he was first stabbed in the chest and then shot in the forehead at point-blank. There's gunpowder residue around the bullet hole, which indicates the gun was fired very close. The order of injuries is important. If he was stabbed first, maybe he was incapacitated, so he couldn't fight back. But then the testimony says the victim wasn't fighting back. However, the contradiction might come from the fact that the victim was stabbed first, which would mean that after the stabbing, he couldn't fight back, so the subsequent shooting would fit the testimony. Hmm, maybe not the best.

Wait, Evidence 9 is the Pistol. It's the murder weapon, which was Grey's own gun. Two shots were fired, and it has Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. If the gun was used to shoot Grey, but he was stabbed first, maybe the fingerprints on the gun are important. But how does that contradict the testimony?

Looking at Testimony 3 again: Maya attacked and killed someone not fighting back. If Grey was stabbed first, he might have been unable to fight back when shot. So the testimony is saying the victim wasn't fighting back during the attack, which aligns with being stabbed first. Maybe not a contradiction here.

Another angle: Evidence 10 is the Knife, which has Maya's fingerprints. If Maya used the knife to stab Grey, then shot him, the testimony would be accurate. But maybe the contradiction lies elsewhere.

Wait, Evidence 11 is Maya's Costume. It has blood splatters and a bullet hole in the sleeve. The costume is otherwise clean. If Maya was shot at, that bullet hole could mean someone else fired at her. But the testimony says she attacked someone who wasn't fighting back. If there's a bullet hole in her sleeve, maybe she was defending herself, which contradicts the testimony that the victim wasn't fighting back. Because if someone shot at her (the bullet hole), then the victim (Grey) might have been fighting back by firing the gun. But wait, the autopsy says Grey was shot after being stabbed. So maybe Grey couldn't have fired the gun after being stabbed. Unless the gun was fired by someone else.

Wait, the pistol (Evidence 9) has Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. If Grey was stabbed first, he couldn't have fired the gun. So Maya might have fired it, but why would Grey's fingerprints be on it? Unless he handled it before the stabbing. Alternatively, maybe the gun was in his hand when he was stabbed, leading to his fingerprints. But the key contradiction here is that if Grey was already stabbed and unable to fight back, then the gunshot would be the killing blow, which matches the testimony. But the bullet hole in Maya's costume suggests she was shot at. So if Grey had the gun and shot at Maya (hence the hole in her sleeve), then he was fighting back, which contradicts Testimony 3's claim that the victim wasn't fighting back.

So Evidence 11 (Maya's Costume with bullet hole) suggests that someone shot at her, implying the victim (Grey) might have fired the gun. But according to the autopsy, Grey was stabbed first, then shot. If Grey was stabbed first, he couldn't have fired the gun afterwards. Therefore, the presence of a bullet hole in Maya's sleeve suggests that someone else shot at her, possibly Grey before he was stabbed, which would mean he was fighting back, contradicting Testimony 3. Alternatively, the bullet hole in her sleeve could have occurred during the struggle. If Grey managed to fire the gun (leaving his fingerprints) but Maya was the one who ended up with the gun, then the fact that he fired at her would mean he was fighting back, making Testimony 3 false. Therefore, Evidence 11 contradicts Testimony 3 because the bullet hole suggests that the victim (Grey) did attempt to fight back by shooting at Maya, which would mean the testimony that he wasn't fighting back is incorrect.

Testimony 0
Testimony: During the channeling, the defendant saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 1
Testimony: Of course, the victim used the last of his strength to fight back, sir.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 2
Testimony: While the two were fighting, the victim took out his gun.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 3
Testimony: The victim took a shot, but because they were too close, he missed.
Person: Gumshoe
Testimony 4
Testimony: The defendant then picked up on the opening and took the victim's gun, and ended it...
Person: Gumshoe

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
cot:
Okay, let's see. I need to find which evidence and testimony contradict each other. The user provided a list of characters, evidences, and testimonies. Let me start by going through the testimonies first, since they're from Detective Gumshoe.

Testimony 0: During the channeling, the defendant (Maya) saw her chance to stab the victim in the chest. So this says Maya stabbed Dr. Grey during the channeling.

Testimony 1: Victim used his last strength to fight back. Then Testimony 2 says during the fight, the victim took out his gun. Testimony 3 says the victim took a shot but missed because they were too close. Testimony 4 says Maya then took the gun and ended it.

Now looking at the evidence. Let's check the autopsy report first (Evidence 8). It says Dr. Grey was stabbed in the chest first, then shot at point-blank. The gunpowder residue around the bullet hole suggests the shot was very close. The pistol (Evidence 9) has two shots fired, with Maya's and Grey's fingerprints. The knife (Evidence 10) has Maya's fingerprints. 

Maya's Costume (Evidence 11) has blood splatters and a bullet hole in the sleeve. The caption mentions that a point-blank shot leaves a burn around the hole. But her robe's sleeve has a bullet hole, which would mean she was shot at point-blank. However, according to the testimonies, the victim shot at her but missed because they were too close. Wait, Testimony 3 says the victim's shot missed because they were too close. But if there's a bullet hole in Maya's sleeve, that would mean she was hit, not missed. 

So Testimony 3 claims the victim's shot missed, but Evidence 11 (Maya's Costume) shows a bullet hole in her sleeve. That's a contradiction. The testimony says the shot missed, but the evidence shows Maya was actually hit, meaning the shot didn't miss. Therefore, Testimony 3 and Evidence 11 contradict each other.
